Definition: You will be shown a protein. Your job is to describe {Biological Summary}, and this protein should be {Relationship Summary}. {Task-Specific Relationship}
Task-Specific Relationship: Association is determined by whether or not a protein demonstrates molecular relationship between its genetic variation and phenotypic expression of the disease described. In other words, whether or not alterations (mutations) of a protein cause a disease or increase the risk of developing a disease.
